\sphinxAtStartPar
Save new NER annotations and labels to the database as an entry for the logged in user, for the document. If there
are already annotations, use a patch request to update with the new annotations. If there are not, use a post

\subparagraph{\sphinxstyleliteralintitle{\sphinxupquote{pine.backend.collections}}}
\label{\detokenize{autoapi/pine/backend/collections/index:module-pine.backend.collections}}\label{\detokenize{autoapi/pine/backend/collections/index:pine-backend-collections}}\label{\detokenize{autoapi/pine/backend/collections/index::doc}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!pine.backend.collections@\spxentry{pine.backend.collections}}\index{pine.backend.collections@\spxentry{pine.backend.collections}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This module contains the api methods required to interact with, organize, create, and display collections in the
front\sphinxhyphen{}end and store the collections in the backend

\index{\_upload\_documents() (in module pine.backend.collections.bp)@\spxentry{\_upload\_documents()}\spxextra{in module pine.backend.collections.bp}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{autoapi/pine/backend/collections/bp/index:pine.backend.collections.bp._upload_documents}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pine.backend.collections.bp.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{\_upload\_documents}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{collection}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{docs}}}{}
\end{fulllineitems}

\index{create\_collection() (in module pine.backend.collections.bp)@\spxentry{create\_collection()}\spxextra{in module pine.backend.collections.bp}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{autoapi/pine/backend/collections/bp/index:pine.backend.collections.bp.create_collection}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pine.backend.collections.bp.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{create\_collection}}}{}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Create a new collection based upon the entries provided in the POST request’s associated form fields.
These fields include:
collection \sphinxhyphen{} collection name
overlap \sphinxhyphen{} ratio of overlapping documents. (0\sphinxhyphen{}1) with 0 being no overlap and 1 being every document has overlap, ex:
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
.90 \sphinxhyphen{} 90\% of documents overlap
\end{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
train\_every \sphinxhyphen{} automatically train a new classifier after this many documents have been annotated
pipelineId \sphinxhyphen{} the id value of the classifier pipeline associated with this collection (spacy, opennlp, corenlp)
classifierParameters \sphinxhyphen{} optional parameters that adjust the configuration of the chosen classifier pipeline.
archived \sphinxhyphen{} whether or not this collection should be archived.
A collection can be created with documents listed in a csv file. Each new line in the csv represents a new document.
The data of this csv can be passed to this method through the POST request’s FILES field “file”.
used when creating a collection based on an uploaded csv file:
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
csvTextCol \sphinxhyphen{} column of csv containing the text of the documents (default: 0)
csvHasHeader \sphinxhyphen{} boolean for whether or not the csv file has a header row (default: False)
\end{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
A collection can also be created with a number of images through FILES fields “imageFileN” where N is an (ignored) index
:return: information about the created collection

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{remove\_eve\_fields() (in module pine.backend.data.service)@\spxentry{remove\_eve\_fields()}\spxextra{in module pine.backend.data.service}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{autoapi/pine/backend/data/service/index:pine.backend.data.service.remove_eve_fields}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pine.backend.data.service.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{remove\_eve\_fields}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{obj}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#dict}{dict}}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{remove\_timestamps}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html\#bool}{bool}} \DUrole{o}{=} \DUrole{default_value}{True}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{remove\_versions}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html\#bool}{bool}} \DUrole{o}{=} \DUrole{default_value}{True}}}{{ $\rightarrow$ \sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/constants.html\#None}{None}}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Removes the fields that eve adds that aren’t necessarily relevant to the data.  The object
that is passed in is modified in\sphinxhyphen{}place.

\sphinxAtStartPar
This currently includes: \sphinxtitleref{\_etag}, \sphinxtitleref{\_links}, \sphinxtitleref{\_created} (if \sphinxtitleref{remove\_timestamps}), \sphinxtitleref{\_updated} (if
\sphinxtitleref{remove\_timestamps}), \sphinxtitleref{\_version} (if \sphinxtitleref{remove\_versions}), and \sphinxtitleref{\_latest\_version} (if
\sphinxtitleref{remove\_versions}).
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{obj}} \textendash{} dict: the object to modify

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{remove\_timestamps}} \textendash{} bool: whether to remove timestamp fields (defaults to \sphinxtitleref{True})

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{remove\_versions}} \textendash{} bool: whether to remove version fields (defaults to \sphinxtitleref{True})

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Channel Watchdog Implementation.
In asyncio, it monitors the channel\sphinxhyphen{}ttl keys and the channels SET to expire registered services as needed.
The other functionality is to register new channels as they’re added to the pubsub in the processing listener.

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{compute\_total\_f1\_matrix() (pine.backend.pineiaa.bratiaa.agree.F1Agreement method)@\spxentry{compute\_total\_f1\_matrix()}\spxextra{pine.backend.pineiaa.bratiaa.agree.F1Agreement method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{autoapi/pine/backend/pineiaa/bratiaa/agree/index:pine.backend.pineiaa.bratiaa.agree.F1Agreement.compute_total_f1_matrix}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{compute\_total\_f1\_matrix}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{self}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Returns (n x n) matrix, where n is the number of annotators, containing
pair\sphinxhyphen{}wise total F1 scores between all annotators.

\sphinxAtStartPar
By definition, the matrix is symmetric and F1 = 1 on the main diagonal.

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{exact\_match\_token\_evaluation() (in module pine.backend.pineiaa.bratiaa.evaluation)@\spxentry{exact\_match\_token\_evaluation()}\spxextra{in module pine.backend.pineiaa.bratiaa.evaluation}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{autoapi/pine/backend/pineiaa/bratiaa/evaluation/index:pine.backend.pineiaa.bratiaa.evaluation.exact_match_token_evaluation}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pine.backend.pineiaa.bratiaa.evaluation.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{exact\_match\_token\_evaluation}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{ann\_list\_1}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{ann\_list\_2}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{tokens}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Annotations are split into token\sphinxhyphen{}sized bits before true positives, false positives and false negatives are computed.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Sub\sphinxhyphen{}token annotations are expanded to full tokens. Long annotations will influence the results more than short
annotations. Boundary errors for adjacent annotations with the same label are ignored!

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{counter2list() (in module pine.backend.pineiaa.bratiaa.evaluation)@\spxentry{counter2list()}\spxextra{in module pine.backend.pineiaa.bratiaa.evaluation}}

\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{autoapi/pine/backend/pineiaa/bratiaa/evaluation/index:pine.backend.pineiaa.bratiaa.evaluation.counter2list}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pine.backend.pineiaa.bratiaa.evaluation.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{counter2list}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{c}}}{}
\end{fulllineitems}

\index{\_read\_token\_annotations() (in module pine.backend.pineiaa.bratiaa.evaluation)@\spxentry{\_read\_token\_annotations()}\spxextra{in module pine.backend.pineiaa.bratiaa.evaluation}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{autoapi/pine/backend/pineiaa/bratiaa/evaluation/index:pine.backend.pineiaa.bratiaa.evaluation._read_token_annotations}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pine.backend.pineiaa.bratiaa.evaluation.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{\_read\_token\_annotations}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{ann\_list}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{tokens}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Yields a new annotation for each token overlapping with an annotation. If annotations are overlapping each other,
there will be multiple annotations for a single token.

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{compute\_total\_f1\_matrix() (pine.backend.pineiaa.bratiaa.F1Agreement method)@\spxentry{compute\_total\_f1\_matrix()}\spxextra{pine.backend.pineiaa.bratiaa.F1Agreement method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{autoapi/pine/backend/pineiaa/bratiaa/index:pine.backend.pineiaa.bratiaa.F1Agreement.compute_total_f1_matrix}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{compute\_total\_f1\_matrix}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{self}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Returns (n x n) matrix, where n is the number of annotators, containing
pair\sphinxhyphen{}wise total F1 scores between all annotators.

\sphinxAtStartPar
By definition, the matrix is symmetric and F1 = 1 on the main diagonal.

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{draw\_heatmap() (pine.backend.pineiaa.bratiaa.F1Agreement method)@\spxentry{draw\_heatmap()}\spxextra{pine.backend.pineiaa.bratiaa.F1Agreement method}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Draws heatmap based on square matrix of F1 scores.

\end{fulllineitems}


\end{fulllineitems}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{exact\_match\_token\_evaluation() (in module pine.backend.pineiaa.bratiaa)@\spxentry{exact\_match\_token\_evaluation()}\spxextra{in module pine.backend.pineiaa.bratiaa}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{autoapi/pine/backend/pineiaa/bratiaa/index:pine.backend.pineiaa.bratiaa.exact_match_token_evaluation}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pine.backend.pineiaa.bratiaa.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{exact\_match\_token\_evaluation}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{ann\_list\_1}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{ann\_list\_2}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{tokens}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Annotations are split into token\sphinxhyphen{}sized bits before true positives, false positives and false negatives are computed.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Sub\sphinxhyphen{}token annotations are expanded to full tokens. Long annotations will influence the results more than short
annotations. Boundary errors for adjacent annotations with the same label are ignored!

\end{fulllineitems}

\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{autoapi/pine/backend/shared/transform/index:pine.backend.shared.transform.transform_module_by_config}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pine.backend.shared.transform.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{transform\_module\_by\_config}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{module\_ref}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{config\_ref}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{config\_prefix}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Transforms a given module’s properties based on ConfigBuilder Values.
The prefix can be used to avoid blindy changing values and target a subset of matching values in config\_ref.
:type module\_ref: ModuleType
:type config\_ref: dict
:type config\_prefix: str

\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{autoapi/pine/client/client/index:pine.client.client.PineClient.classifier_train}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{classifier\_train}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{self}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{classifier\_id}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#str}{str}}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{model\_name}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#str}{str}} \DUrole{o}{=} \DUrole{default_value}{\textquotesingle{}auto\sphinxhyphen{}trained\textquotesingle{}}}}{{ $\rightarrow$ \sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#dict}{dict}}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Trains the given classifier (using collection documents).

\sphinxAtStartPar
Note that training is done asynchronously, so this method should return very quickly.  One
of the things returned in the dict will be a job ID.  If you want to know when the training
has finished, you can periodically poll {\hyperref[\detokenize{autoapi/pine/client/client/index:pine.client.client.PineClient.get_classifier_running_jobs}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{get\_classifier\_running\_jobs()}}}}} and check
for that job ID.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{classifier\_id}} \textendash{} str: classifier ID

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{model\_name}} \textendash{} str: name of model corresponding to filename on disk, defaults to
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{"auto\sphinxhyphen{}trained"}} which is the same as the annotation\sphinxhyphen{}based
model training

\end{itemize}

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#dict}{dict}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{classifier\_has\_trained() (pine.client.client.PineClient method)@\spxentry{classifier\_has\_trained()}\spxextra{pine.client.client.PineClient method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}

\sphinxAtStartPar

\index{classifier\_predict() (pine.client.client.PineClient method)@\spxentry{classifier\_predict()}\spxextra{pine.client.client.PineClient method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{autoapi/pine/client/client/index:pine.client.client.PineClient.classifier_predict}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{classifier\_predict}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{self}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{classifier\_id}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{document\_ids}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{List\DUrole{p}{{[}}\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#str}{str}\DUrole{p}{{]}}}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{texts}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{List\DUrole{p}{{[}}\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#str}{str}\DUrole{p}{{]}}}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{timeout\_in\_s}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html\#int}{int}} \DUrole{o}{=} \DUrole{default_value}{36000}}}{{ $\rightarrow$ \sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#dict}{dict}}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Runs classifier prediction on the given documents.  At least one of document\_ids and
texts must be non\sphinxhyphen{}empty.

\sphinxAtStartPar
This prediction uses the last\sphinxhyphen{}trained model name for that classifier.  This method will
block until the prediction has finished and then return the results.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{classifier\_id}} \textendash{} str: classifier ID

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{document\_ids}} \textendash{} list{[}str{]}: a list of document IDs to run prediction on

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{texts}} \textendash{} list{[}str{]}: a list of direct document texts to run prediction on

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{timeout\_in\_s}} \textendash{} int: max timeout in seconds before erroring out and returning, defaults
to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{36000}}

\end{itemize}

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#dict}{dict}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{setup\_logging() (in module pine.client.log)@\spxentry{setup\_logging()}\spxextra{in module pine.client.log}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{autoapi/pine/client/log/index:pine.client.log.setup_logging}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pine.client.log.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{setup\_logging}}}{}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Sets up logging, if configured to do so.

\sphinxAtStartPar
The environment variable named by {\hyperref[\detokenize{autoapi/pine/client/log/index:pine.client.log.CONFIG_FILE_ENV}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{CONFIG\_FILE\_ENV}}}}} is checked and, if present, is
passed to \sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.config.html\#logging.config.dictConfig}{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{logging.config.dictConfig()}}}.

\end{fulllineitems}

Checks whether the given form and files parameters are valid for creating a collection.

\sphinxAtStartPar
A valid form has a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{collection}} that is a dict field and is valid via
{\hyperref[\detokenize{autoapi/pine/client/models/index:pine.client.models.is_valid_eve_collection}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{is\_valid\_eve\_collection()}}}}}.  Additionally, the collection has string \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{title}} and
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{description}} fields in its \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{metadata}}.  It also has at least one element for \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{labels}},
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{viewers}}, and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{annotators}}, and the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{creator\_id}} must be in both \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{viewers}} and
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{annotators}}.

\sphinxAtStartPar
The form also has \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{overlap}} as a float field between 0 and 1 (inclusive), \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{train\_every}} as
an int field that is at least 5, and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pipelineId}} as a string field.

\sphinxAtStartPar
If files are provided, file \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{file}} and any files starting with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{imageFile}} are checked.
If a file \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{file}} is provided, the form must also have a boolean \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{csvHasHeader}} field and an
int \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{csvTextCol}} field.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar

\index{classifier\_train() (pine.client.PineClient method)@\spxentry{classifier\_train()}\spxextra{pine.client.PineClient method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{autoapi/pine/client/index:pine.client.PineClient.classifier_train}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{classifier\_train}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{self}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{classifier\_id}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#str}{str}}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{model\_name}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#str}{str}} \DUrole{o}{=} \DUrole{default_value}{\textquotesingle{}auto\sphinxhyphen{}trained\textquotesingle{}}}}{{ $\rightarrow$ \sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#dict}{dict}}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Trains the given classifier (using collection documents).

\sphinxAtStartPar
Note that training is done asynchronously, so this method should return very quickly.  One
of the things returned in the dict will be a job ID.  If you want to know when the training
has finished, you can periodically poll {\hyperref[\detokenize{autoapi/pine/client/index:pine.client.PineClient.get_classifier_running_jobs}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{get\_classifier\_running\_jobs()}}}}} and check
for that job ID.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{classifier\_id}} \textendash{} str: classifier ID

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{model\_name}} \textendash{} str: name of model corresponding to filename on disk, defaults to
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{"auto\sphinxhyphen{}trained"}} which is the same as the annotation\sphinxhyphen{}based
model training

\end{itemize}

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#dict}{dict}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{classifier\_has\_trained() (pine.client.PineClient method)@\spxentry{classifier\_has\_trained()}\spxextra{pine.client.PineClient method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{autoapi/pine/client/index:pine.client.PineClient.classifier_has_trained}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{classifier\_has\_trained}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{self}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{classifier\_id}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#str}{str}}}}{{ $\rightarrow$ \sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html\#bool}{bool}}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Returns whether the given classifier has been trained or not.

\sphinxAtStartPar
If False, future calls to predict will fail.

\index{classifier\_predict() (pine.client.PineClient method)@\spxentry{classifier\_predict()}\spxextra{pine.client.PineClient method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{autoapi/pine/client/index:pine.client.PineClient.classifier_predict}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{classifier\_predict}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{self}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{classifier\_id}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{document\_ids}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{List\DUrole{p}{{[}}\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#str}{str}\DUrole{p}{{]}}}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{texts}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{List\DUrole{p}{{[}}\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#str}{str}\DUrole{p}{{]}}}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{timeout\_in\_s}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html\#int}{int}} \DUrole{o}{=} \DUrole{default_value}{36000}}}{{ $\rightarrow$ \sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#dict}{dict}}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Runs classifier prediction on the given documents.  At least one of document\_ids and
texts must be non\sphinxhyphen{}empty.

\sphinxAtStartPar
This prediction uses the last\sphinxhyphen{}trained model name for that classifier.  This method will
block until the prediction has finished and then return the results.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{classifier\_id}} \textendash{} str: classifier ID

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{document\_ids}} \textendash{} list{[}str{]}: a list of document IDs to run prediction on

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{texts}} \textendash{} list{[}str{]}: a list of direct document texts to run prediction on

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{timeout\_in\_s}} \textendash{} int: max timeout in seconds before erroring out and returning, defaults
to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{36000}}

\end{itemize}

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#dict}{dict}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{setup\_logging() (in module pine.client)@\spxentry{setup\_logging()}\spxextra{in module pine.client}}

\begin{fulllineitems}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Sets up logging, if configured to do so.

\sphinxAtStartPar
The environment variable named by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{CONFIG\_FILE\_ENV}} is checked and, if present, is
passed to \sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.config.html\#logging.config.dictConfig}{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{logging.config.dictConfig()}}}.

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{autoapi/pine/pipelines/shared/transform/index:pine.pipelines.shared.transform.transform_module_by_config}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pine.pipelines.shared.transform.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{transform\_module\_by\_config}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{module\_ref}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{config\_ref}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{config\_prefix}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Transforms a given module’s properties based on ConfigBuilder Values.
The prefix can be used to avoid blindy changing values and target a subset of matching values in config\_ref.
:type module\_ref: ModuleType
:type config\_ref: dict
:type config\_prefix: str

\sphinxAtStartPar

\sphinxAtStartPar

\index{get\_document\_ranking() (pine.pipelines.NER\_API.ner\_api method)@\spxentry{get\_document\_ranking()}\spxextra{pine.pipelines.NER\_API.ner\_api method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{autoapi/pine/pipelines/NER_API/index:pine.pipelines.NER_API.ner_api.get_document_ranking}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{get\_document\_ranking}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{self}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{model}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{{\hyperref[\detokenize{autoapi/pine/pipelines/pmap_ner/index:pine.pipelines.pmap_ner.NER}]{\sphinxcrossref{pine.pipelines.pmap\_ner.NER}}}}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{doc\_map}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{Dict\DUrole{p}{{[}}\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#str}{str}\DUrole{p}{, }\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#str}{str}\DUrole{p}{{]}}}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{doc\_ids}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{List\DUrole{p}{{[}}\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#str}{str}\DUrole{p}{{]}}}}}{{ $\rightarrow$ List\DUrole{p}{{[}}\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#str}{str}\DUrole{p}{{]}}}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Calculates document rankings and returns document IDs sorted by ranking.

\sphinxAtStartPar
The ranking should be which documents should be evaluated first.  This probably
corresponds in some ways to the documents which the model is least confident about.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{model}} \textendash{} NER model

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{doc\_map}} \textendash{} dict: mapping of document IDs to document text where overlap is 0

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{doc\_ids}} \textendash{} list: IDs of documents where ???

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxAtStartPar
sorted document IDs

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#list}{list}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{rank() (in module pine.pipelines.RankingFunctions)@\spxentry{rank()}\spxextra{in module pine.pipelines.RankingFunctions}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{autoapi/pine/pipelines/RankingFunctions/index:pine.pipelines.RankingFunctions.rank}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pine.pipelines.RankingFunctions.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{rank}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{document\_ids}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{List\DUrole{p}{{[}}\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#str}{str}\DUrole{p}{{]}}}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{results}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{List\DUrole{p}{{[}}{\hyperref[\detokenize{autoapi/pine/pipelines/pipeline/index:pine.pipelines.pipeline.DocumentPredictionProbabilities}]{\sphinxcrossref{pine.pipelines.pipeline.DocumentPredictionProbabilities}}}\DUrole{p}{{]}}}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{metric}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#str}{str}}}}{{ $\rightarrow$ List\DUrole{p}{{[}}Tuple\DUrole{p}{{[}}\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#str}{str}\DUrole{p}{, }\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html\#float}{float}\DUrole{p}{{]}}\DUrole{p}{{]}}}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
if metric == ‘lc’: return least\_confidence(results)
if metric == ‘ma’: return largest\_margin(results)
if metric == ‘en’: return entropy\_rank(results)
if metric == ‘lcs’: return least\_confidence\_squared(results)
if metric == ‘lce’: return least\_confidence\_squared\_by\_entity(results)
if metric == ‘ra’: return random\_rank(results)
if metric == ‘mlp’: return most\_of\_least\_popular(results)
return \sphinxhyphen{}1

\sphinxAtStartPar
\#Dictionary method is inefficient as it runs every method before returning one

\end{fulllineitems}
